body.p:
I Regret very much the loss of some of the public buildings and Archives of our state particularly after your efforts to have them improved which had ammounted to a complete success But in the midst of the destruction of both public and Private property by force as by accident you are aware from experience that the demands of your fellow citizens by petition & otherwise continues to be made on your Executive Clemency Here please find enclosed the Petition of Thomas O'Brien
asking the Remission of two fines imposed by the Police Judge and a Jury of Ashland Ky the facts of his case are stated on his Petition and sworn to by him I am convinced Governer his is a case of merit & hope you will Remit as asked for in his petition

I also send you the petition of Ballard Repass to have remited a fine imposed on him by the Lawrence circuit Court for tipling: he is a boy and a very bad criple, he is Fatherless and is in Jail for the nonpayment of the fine. He is Quite a feeble boy in health and is unable to pay the fine His appearance was entered by a man who was not
not a lawyer and Judgment was rendered against him by Default,
His is an extreme case and Humanity calls loudly for his help,; This Judgment was rendered at the last MayOct term of said Court
Please find enclosed $2 in each case for the Remissions, if Granted If not please return

I am very truly your
friend & obt servt
John M, Burns
